descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Media Strategy explores how organizations design and allocate media advertising spending. Particular focus is given to the processes and procedures that facilitate media innovation and creativity. A media brief for a new brand launch provided at the start of the course serves as the basis for weekly exercises in media decision-making. After reviewing the appropriate theory and research, students assess media alternatives, decide what is best for the brand and present and discuss their choices in class. A final project will challenge students to pull media decisions together into a cohesive recommendation.
